communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, we hereby request the following information:

Your agency name
Your agency state
Your agency type   Business, Education K12, Education Higher
Your agency CEO

Breach is defined for this request as
A: An external actor that forcibly entered the system and accessed information
B: An internal actor that released or shared information that was not appropriate to share or shared intentionally without regard for entity protocol.

Please list any breach that was reported using the following format for the time period July 1, 2021 until July 1, 2023. Label each breach logically as Breach 1 or Breach 2, etc.*List each breach categorized as a document or an email as a separate breach.

For each breach provide the following information
1. Was this event for documents or email?
2. Date breach was reported
3. The position of the person reporting the breach
4. Highest position of  administration the breach was reported to for the agency
5. Was the process or procedure for evaluating and notifying those impacted followed? 
6. Were stakeholders with breached data notified?   If so, what timeline after the breach was reported (weeks, days, hours)  to the CEO listed above was the notification sent to those impacted?
7. What method(s) was used to notify stakeholders of the breach? Example, newspaper, social media, email, phone, mail, etc.
8. Was any protection such as credit monitoring or other protective opportunities provided to stakeholders affected?
9. Was the breached information considered protected under HIPAA or FERPA?
10. Count of records breached for category 1 above. (Emails and documents should NOT be included in the same count but reported as separate events even if the same date)
11. If the agency's process or procedure for evaluating and notification were not followed, what was the reasoning and by whom was the decision made to not follow the process or procedure?

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,
FOIA Disclosure Group

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (El Paso Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (El Paso Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W134921-071623
communications.communication:
In September 2021, the City of El Paso will transition to a hybrid work schedule. The City will continue to comply with the requirements of the TPIA. However, for more information on calculation of business days in light of COVID-19, please see HERE. 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of El Paso. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was given the reference number W134921-071623 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fel-paso-police-department-673%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-el-paso-police-department-149200%252F%253Femail%253Dpdpios%252540elpasotexas.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdlGz2GYoq6bHmQag_-YGYfeA%3A1qLE70%3AQXyGhLXoXG_s1VMG9VRBe2PHKMKRr7C-qXXiHz6hnYI 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Information Center. 
City of El Paso

Re:  Open Record Request # W134921-071623 

Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 

Your request, received 07/17/2023, has been forwarded to me and is being treated as a request for records under the Texas Public Information Act (Tex. Gov't Code Ann. §552.001 et seq.).  You requested the following information: 

 "...To Whom It May Concern:Please click on the link below to view the City's response to your information request.  The documents are available in an electronic format; therefore, there will be no charge for this response and your request is now considered closed. 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
